first_reading.title: Book of Zephaniah
first_reading.text:
[[So 3,14]]Shout for joy, O daughter Zion! sing joyfully, O Israel! Be glad and exult with all your heart, O daughter Jerusalem!
[[So 3,15]]The LORD has removed the judgment against you, he has turned away your enemies; The King of Israel, the LORD, is in your midst, you have no further misfortune to fear.
[[So 3,16]]On that day, it shall be said to Jerusalem: Fear not, O Zion, be not discouraged!
[[So 3,17]]The LORD, your God, is in your midst, a mighty savior; He will rejoice over you with gladness, and renew you in his love, He will sing joyfully because of you,
[[So 3,18a]]as one sings at festivals.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
gospel.text:
[[Lc 1,39]]Mary set out in those days and traveled to the hill country in haste to a town of Judah,
[[Lc 1,40]]where she entered the house of Zechariah and greeted Elizabeth.
[[Lc 1,41]]When Elizabeth heard Mary's greeting, the infant leaped in her womb, and Elizabeth, filled with the holy Spirit,
[[Lc 1,42]]cried out in a loud voice and said, "Most blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of your womb.
[[Lc 1,43]]And how does this happen to me, that the mother of my Lord should come to me?
[[Lc 1,44]]For at the moment the sound of your greeting reached my ears, the infant in my womb leaped for joy.
[[Lc 1,45]]Blessed are you who believed that what was spoken to you by the Lord would be fulfilled."
[[Lc 1,46]]And Mary said: "My soul proclaims the greatness of the Lord;
[[Lc 1,47]]my spirit rejoices in God my savior.
[[Lc 1,48]]For he has looked with favor on his lowly servant; 
from this day all generations will call me blessed.
[[Lc 1,49]]The Almighty has done great things for me, 
and holy is his name.
[[Lc 1,50]]He has mercy on those who fear him
in every generation.
[[Lc 1,51]]He has shown might with his arm, dispersed the arrogant of mind and heart.
[[Lc 1,52]]He has thrown down the rulers from their thrones but lifted up the lowly.
[[Lc 1,53]]He has filled the hungry with good things; 
and the rich he has sent away empty.
[[Lc 1,54]]He has come to the help of his servant Israel , 
remembering his promise of mercy,
[[Lc 1,55]]The promise he made to our fathers, 
to Abraham and to his descendants forever."
[[Lc 1,56]]Mary remained with her about three months and then returned to her home.

psalm.title: Book of Isaiah
psalm.text:
[[Is 12,2]]God indeed is my savior; 
I am confident and unafraid. 
My strength and my courage is the LORD, 
and he has been my savior.

[[Is 12,3]]With joy you will draw water 
at the fountain of salvation.
[[Is 12,4b]]Give thanks to the LORD, acclaim his name;
[[Is 12,4c]]among the nations make known his deeds,
[[Is 12,4d]]proclaim how exalted is his name.

[[Is 12,5]]Sing praise to the LORD for his glorious achievement; 
let this be known throughout all the earth.
[[Is 12,6]]Shout with exultation, O city of Zion, 
for great in your midst 
is the Holy One of Israel!
